main event: A round, luminous object was observed to be stationary in the sky for 30 minutes in Albuquerque, New Mexico on September 24, 1952. The reliable witness reported the object appearing and disappearing gradually in the clear night sky.
interesting points: The object was observed for a significant duration of 30 minutes, indicating a prolonged sighting.
The witness was described as reliable, adding credibility to the report.
The object was reported to be luminous, round, and stationary, with its appearance and disappearance described as gradual.
No physical evidence or photographs were available to corroborate the sighting.
The trajectory of the object was considered flat or only slightly climbing, and it appeared to be not more than 230-300 feet from the aircraft, adding details about the object's proximity.
